dt: {bc}to lay or cover with material (such as asphalt or concrete) that forms a firm level surface for travel
{bc}to cover firmly and solidly as if with paving material
{bc}to serve as a covering or {a_link|pavement} of
{bc}to prepare a smooth easy way {bc}facilitate development

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}paver{/it}, from Latin {it}pavire{/it} to strike, pound; perhaps akin to Greek {it}paiein{/it} to strike
shortdef: to lay or cover with material (such as asphalt or concrete) that forms a firm level surface for travel
to cover firmly and solidly as if with paving material
to serve as a covering or pavement of

dt.t: This project will include … fixing curbs and sidewalks, and {wi}re-paving{/wi} with asphalt.

dt: {bc}to cover (an area) with roads, parking lots, buildings, etc.

dt.t: All this beautiful farmland will be {it}paved over{/it}.

shortdef: to cover (an area) with roads, parking lots, buildings, etc.
